title: Anne Bronte [2008] Two BBC Radio Dramatisations [ogg] [radioCat]
description:
Anne Bronte

Two radio dramatisations depicting the life and work of Anne Bronte

1. Agnes Grey by Anne Bronte
2. Gondal by Martyn Wade

Anne Bronte

Often overshadowed by her more famous sisters, Anne&#039;s novels are written in a sharp, ironic, realistic style, completely different from the romanticism of Charlotte and Emily.  Her novels, like those of her sisters, have become classics of English literature. (wiki)

Agnes Grey

Agnes Grey, written in 1847 is about a governess of that name and is said to be based on BrontÃƒÂ«&#039;s own experiences in the field. It was BrontÃƒÂ«&#039;s first novel. Similar Charlotte&#039;s novel Jane Eyre, it addresses the precarious position of governess and how it affected a young woman. (wiki)

Gondal

Emily and Anne conceived a romantic legend centered upon the imaginary Pacific Ocean island of Gondal. In this dramatic reconstruction Martyn Wade explores the parallels between the Bronte sisters&#039; home life in Haworth, and the epic fantasy world. (wiki, BBC)
